citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live dogs and cats.
citations.narrative:
A 9-week-old, male, German shepherd dog flew (flight AA 4279) into John F. Kennedy International (JFK) from Northern
Kentucky International (CVG) on August 16, 2023 (AWB# 001CVG79929990). The dog’s primary enclosure contained
inadequate space. The dog’s height exceeded the enclosure’s height. Inadequate space during transport can cause
stress, uncomfortable conditions, and prevents normal postural adjustments. Primary enclosures used to transport live
dogs must be large enough to ensure each animal has enough space to turn about normally while standing, to stand and
sit erect and to lie in a natural position.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with airline representatives.
n

narrative:
3.15(e)(1)  Critical
   
Primary enclosures used to transport live dogs and cats. 
A 9-week-old, male, German shepherd dog flew (flight AA 4279) into John F. Kennedy International (JFK) from Northern 
Kentucky International (CVG) on August 16, 2023 (AWB# 001CVG79929990). The dog’s primary enclosure contained 
inadequate space. The dog’s height exceeded the enclosure’s height. Inadequate space during transport can cause 
stress, uncomfortable conditions, and prevents normal postural adjustments. Primary enclosures used to transport live 
dogs must be large enough to ensure each animal has enough space to turn about normally while standing, to stand and 
sit erect and to lie in a natural position. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with airline representatives. 
 
 n
